page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY-MR.Carter
page.content: Trisha and Luke interviewed Mr. Carter about his life in Wickham. He was born in Chapel Lane in 1916, had always lived in Wickham and had always been a butcher. When he was a boy it had been necessary to take any job, the work situation was very bad. His work was very pleasent as he met lots of people, had a laugh and talked with them and heared all about their troubles and joys, babies being born and weddings. The shop has changed a lot over the years. He remembers the old brass balance scales where the price had to be worked out by the butcher. Now you just tell the scales how much the meat is per per pound and the price is worked out for you.The shop is also far cleaner than it used to be. Hygiene is much stricter and there is now hot and cold water and towels have to be provide for cleaner hands. When he
